questions.question: Sam ………………………… out every morning.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about habitual actions.

questions.question: Every child …………………………….. love.
questions.description: We use a singular verb after each and every.

questions.question: I once ……………………………. to a concert.
questions.description: The simple past is used to talk about finished events.

questions.question: I ………………………………. a strange experience yesterday.
questions.description: Had is the past tense form of has/have.

questions.question: I …………………………….. a chance to meet them when I was in America.
questions.description: Here the clause when I was in America clearly indicates that we are talking about past time.

questions.question: The teacher ……………………………………. the child on the back.
The lakes …………………………… up in summer.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about facts and general truths.

questions.question: If she ………………………………. now, we would be in trouble.
questions.description: In the second conditional, we use a simple past tense in the if-clause and would + infinitive in the main clause.

questions.question: He took out his pen and ………………………………… writing.
He who ……………………………… hard will certainly succeed.
I …………………………… the parcel in the morning.
questions.description: The simple past is more common with the time expression in the morning.
